knimeNode.name: RProp MLP Learner
knimeNode.shortDescription: Builds and learns an MLP with resilient backpropagation.

fullDescription.intro: Implementation of the RProp algorithm for multilayer feedforward networks. RPROP performs a local adaptation of the weight-updates according to the behavior of the error function. For further details see: Riedmiller, M. Braun, H. : "A direct adaptive method for faster backpropagation learning: theRPROP algorithm",Proceedings of the IEEE International Conference on Neural Networks (ICNN) (Vol. 16, pp. 586-591). Piscataway, NJ: IEEE. This node provides a view of the error plot.
fullDescription.option: Specifies the number of hidden layers in the architecture of the neural network.

option.name: Number of hidden neurons per layer

fullDescription.option: Specifies the number of neurons contained in each hidden layer.

Choose the column that contains the target variable: it can either be nominal or numerical. All nominal class values are extracted and assigned to output neurons. If you use a numerical target variable (regression), please make sure it is normalized!
If this checkbox is set, rows with missing values will not be used for training.
